quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Novel and Case
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, philip, agatha. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This American officer, the literary creation of Ernest Hemingway, deserts World War I  and escapes to Switzerland with his beloved Catherine Barkley.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frederic Henry

questions.question: This novel is narrated by the fictional character Frank Chambers, a drifter who stops at a roadside diner and meets ‘femme fatale’, Cora. After starting an affair, Cora and Frank murder Cora’s husband, Nick Papadakis, who is the owner of the diner.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ‘The Postman Always Rings Twice’

questions.question: This romantic literary character loves passionately Estella, a beautiful girl, brought up by the cold, wealthy and eccentric Miss Havisham.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pip

questions.question: This pragmatic and opportunistic literary hero is attracted by the pretty and coquettish Scarlett OHara.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhett Butler

questions.question: In the novel ‘A Study In Scarlet’, the word ‘RACHE’ is written in blood on the wall of a deserted house beside a dead body. Name the literary detective who investigates the case.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sherlock Holmes

questions.question: In this famous play Claudius murders his brother, the King of Denmark, and marries the widowed Queen Gertrude.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hamlet

questions.question: In this book, based on a true story, Truman Capote recounts the murders of Herb Clutter, a rich farmer from Kansas, his wife Bonnie, his sixteen-year-old daughter Nancy, and his fifteen-year-old son, Kenyon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ‘In Cold Blood’

questions.question: This author wrote ‘The Road to Gandolfo’, a story in which the former General MacKenzie Hawkins makes up an outrageous plan to kidnap the Pope and to demand a ransom of $400 million – a dollar for every Catholic in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Ludlum

questions.question: This literary character, depicted by the Victorian writer Thomas Hardy, escapes with Tess, the woman he loves, although she had committed a murder.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Angel Clare

questions.question: In this novel, private eye Philip Marlowe is arrested on suspicion of the murder of Terry Lenox’s wife. After Marlowe is released, he finds out that Terry Lenox, himself, has committed suicide in Mexico. When Marlowe gets home, he finds a cryptic note from Lenox and a $5000 bill.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ‘The Long Goodbye’

questions.question: How many works did Stephen King write under the pseudonym Richard Bachman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6

questions.question: In this novel, American millionaire Samuel Edward Ratchett is found stabbed to death during a journey. The case is investigated by detective Hercule Poarot, who is also among the passengers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ‘Murder on the Orient Express’

questions.question: In this bestseller, based on a real case and written by Joe McGinnis, Jeffrey MacDonald is accused of killing his pregnant wife and two young daughters.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ‘Fatal Vision’

questions.question: In this novel the main character, Rodion Razkolnikov, who lives in St. Petersburg, murders an old pawnbroker and her younger sister, and later, gets overwhelmed by feelings of paranoia and self-loathing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crime and Punishment

questions.question: In this novel, written by Agatha Christie, the Banty family discover in their library the dead body of a young woman. Later, the remains of another dead girl are found in a nearby quarry. Which detective investigates the case?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miss Jane Marple

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and Towers
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, parts, diary. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the mouse in the book The Green Mile?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Jingles

questions.question: In the book, Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, does Eowyn have romantic interest in Aragorn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: The Diary of a Madman
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guy de Maupassant

questions.question: In the novel Dolores Claiborne, what is the name of Dolores Claibornes daughter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Selena St. George

questions.question: In the horror novel From a Buick 8, strange reptiles crawled out of the trunk of a car.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the name of Jacks werewolf friend in the novel The Talisman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wolf

questions.question: In Stephen Kings novel The Girl Who Loved Tom Gordon, what position did Tom Gordon play for the Boston Red Sox?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: relief picher

questions.question: Do the orcs ride wolves in the book, Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: They hand in hand, with wandering steps  and slow,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Milton

questions.question: Does Aragorn ever really have a doubt about his place on the throne of Gondor In the book, Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: In the book, Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, does Aragorn fall off of a cliff?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: In the book Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers,  does Gollum ever decide to be on Frodos side?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: In which of the parts that Tolkien originally divided the book in do Aragorn, Gimli, and Legolas decide to go after Merry and Pippin in The Two Towers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First

questions.question: What was one of Randall Flaggs nicknames in Stephen Kings novel The Stand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the walking dude

questions.question: Is Wormtongue really sad when he sees the army of Uruk-Hai in the book, Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Not in the least

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Poet and Talisman
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, space. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Hellbound Heart
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clive Barker

questions.question: The Dunwich Horror; The Colour Out of Space; The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: H.P. Lovecraft

questions.question: The Talisman; Black House
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both

questions.question: Servant of the Bones
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne Rice

questions.question: Which Scottish poet, born in 1759, wrote the famous song Auld Lang Syne which goes like this:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Burns

questions.question: The Doll Who Ate His Mother
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ramsey Campbell

questions.question: As I Lay Dying
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Faulkner

questions.question: The Devils Dictionary
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ambrose Bierce

questions.question: Which Anglo-Scottish poet, author of Childe Harolds Pilgrimage, died in Greece where he participated in the fight for the countrys independence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Gordon Byron

questions.question: Which one of these poems was written by American Modernist poet T. S. Eliot and describes his feeling of depression and pessimism about society after World War I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hollow Men

questions.question: The Tell-tale Heart
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Allan Poe

questions.question: This American poet, born in 1874, won the Pulitzer Prize four times and recited his poem The Gift Outright at the inauguration of U.S. President John F. Kennedy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Frost

questions.question: Which one of these plays by English poet and playwright William Shakespeare is not a comedy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Macbeth

questions.question: How old was the prominent English poet John Keats when he died in 1821?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 26 years old

questions.question: Battlefield Earth
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Mark Twain and William Blakes
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, horizon, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: From my mothers sleep, I fell into the State.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Randall Jarrell

questions.question: The title of the 2004 movie Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind was taken from the poem Eloisa to Abelard written by which English poet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander Pope

questions.question: In which book by Mark Twain is Jim a major character?

options.text: The Celebrated Jumping Frog of Calaveras County

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Huckleberry Finn

questions.question: Success is counted sweetest
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emily Dickinson

questions.question: A heap of broken images, where the Sun beats...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: T.S. Eliot

questions.question: Which Norwegian band used William Blakes influential poem The Marriage of Heaven and Hell as lyrics for their 1998 album Themes from William Blakes The Marriage of Heaven and Hell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulver

questions.question: In which novel does the evil Injun Joe appear?

options.text: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthurs Court

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer

questions.question: Which one of these poems from Walt Whitmans masterpiece collection Leaves of Grass was dedicated to U.S. President Abraham Lincoln?

options.text: Out of the Cradle Endlessly Rocking

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: O Captain! My Captain!

questions.question: I have gone out, a possessed witch,

options.text: woman like that is not a woman, quite.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne Sexton

questions.question: In which work by Mark Twain do we find Adam and Eve writing their diaries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Letters from the Earth

questions.question: Which famous work by American poet Henry W. Longfellow was based on the legends of the Ojibway Indians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Song of Hiawatha

questions.question: And Richard Cory, one calm summer night,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edwin Arlington Robinson

questions.question: I was ten when they buried you.

options.text: d get back, back, back to you.
t they pulled me out of the sack,
d they stuck me together with glue.
d then I knew what to do.
man in black with a Meinkampf look

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sylvia Plath

questions.question: I spit upon this dreadful bankers grave
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Berryman

questions.question: I saw a man pursuing the horizon;
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephen Crane

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Novel and Character
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, monologues, duke. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Aunt Polly is a character from which book?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer

questions.question: Penetrating a Fresh Abyss
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Payne, Jr.

questions.question: In which novel did Mark Twain- Special Travelling Correspondent of the Alta appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Innocents Abroad

questions.question: In this novel we find Cal Higbie and Mark Twain celebrating the curious time when the two were millionaires for ten days?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roughing It

questions.question: This history play by Shakespeare, focusing on a kings Machiavellian rise to power and subsequent reign of terror, contains the following exchange:

options.text: t I know none, and therefore am no beast.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard III

questions.question: Preface to a Twenty Volume Suicide Note
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Immamu Amiri Baraka

questions.question: Why talk of beauty? What could be more beautiful than these heroic happy dead who rushed like lions to the roaring slaughter? They did not stop to think--they died instead. Then shall the voice of liberty be mute?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: E. E. Cummings

questions.question: Dying is an art like everything else. I do it so it feels like hell. I do it so it feels real.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sylvia Plath

questions.question: I saw the best minds of my generation destroyed by madness, starving, hysterical, naked
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Allen Ginsburg

questions.question: Which story features a character named Jim Smiley who was responsible for one of the tallest tales of the Old West?

options.text: The Celebrated Jumping Frog of Calaveras County

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Celebrated Jumping Frog of Calaveras County

questions.question: In which novel do the Duke and the King do their best to swindle god-fearin folk?

options.text: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthurs Court

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Huckleberry Finn

questions.question: In which story does Danl Webster appear as a leading character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Celebrated Jumping Frog

questions.question: This pastoral comedy contains one of Shakespeares most quoted monologues, which opens with the lines, All the worlds a stage,

options.text: d all the men and women merely players.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: As You Like It

questions.question: This is the way they ring the bells in Bedlam
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne Sexton

questions.question: Sir Boss is the protagonist of which novel?

options.text: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthurs Court

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthurs Court

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Novel Twilight and Bella
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, bellas, poet. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the novel Twilight, who accompanied Bella, when she went to Phoenix to try escape the tracker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alice and Jasper

questions.question: This poet, who is famous for his use of lowercase letters and word space, wrote the following:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: e e cummings

questions.question: During his round of questions in the novel Twilight, Edward asks Bella what her favourite gemstone is, to which she immediately answers Topaz, the colour of Edwards eyes. Until recently she would have given a different answer. What did her favourite gemstone use to be?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Garnet

questions.question: In the desert I saw a creature naked, bestial. Squatting on the ground he held his heart in his hands and ate of it. I asked Is it good, friend? It is bitter--bitter he replied but I like it because it is bitter and because it is my heart.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephen Crane

questions.question: In the novel Twilight, Jasper is the newest member of the Cullen family and the last to adopt their vegetarian diet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Bella, the protagonist of the novel Twilight, is tracked by a vampire intent on killing her. What is his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James

questions.question: The Book of Nightmares
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Galway Kinnel

questions.question: In the book Twilight, Edward says he is 17, but admits he has been 17 for a while. In what year was he actually born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1901

questions.question: We are the hollow men. We are the stuffed men. Leaning together-- headpiece filled with straw--alas! Our dried voices when we whisper together are meaningless as wind in dry grass or rats feet over broken glass in our dry cellar....This is the way the world ends not with a bang but a whimper.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: T.S. Eliot

questions.question: In chapter 6 of the novel Twilight, Mike Newton organises a beach trip to this beach.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Beach

questions.question: In the novel Twilight, Carlisle found Edward whilst working in a hospital in Chicago. What was Edward dying of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spanish Influenza

questions.question: Though it is girls choice, who asks Bella to the spring dance in the book Twilight?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What game do the Cullens play in the thunderstorm in the novel Twilight?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baseball

questions.question: What American hero does Henry Wadsworth Longfellow write about in this poem:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Revere

questions.question: In the novel Twilight, Bellas dad Charlie buys her an old Chevy truck as a homecoming gift. What colour is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red
